tweet: b"It's waste of time to be impressed by anybody. Just work on yourself."
b"We all have incomplete understanding of reality. Let's complete the puzzle together and have a clear understanding of what is happening."
b'We should all have a clear understanding of why we have war. We have war because some people want to make money from it. Not because of any other reason.'

b"Anger is aroused when you are confused about the situation. You don't really know why unpleasant things are happening. Once you know the reason, you will still be upset, but knowing that you have a clear understanding will start to help you."
b'We should stop being angry, since it is not good for our health.'
b'Happy Birthday Ringo! @ringostarrmusic \nImagine Peace and lots of love, yoko https://t.co/K9Jc7YBHfT'

b"I don't think we have to work so hard to achieve World Peace. In fact I know we don't need to. And I know we can achieve it in minutes once we know what we have to do. When you need to know it most urgently, well, you will get it very soon."
b'https://t.co/V4vSCEHqBp'
b'Reading books is such an important, interesting, exciting and fun thing to do. Keep on reading anything you can get your hands on.'
b'In your mind, go way, way up into the Universe, and you can see them and love them for what they are.'
b"Listen to your heart, follow your intuition, make your manifestation, There's no limitation. Have courage. Have rage. We are all together."
b"Know that you are part of the world and it's conclusion. What would you like: War or Peace? Peace, I'm sure. Then act like a person of Peace. Send love."
b'Your love is touched by all of us, especially the ones who are feeling unloved. So be extra careful of what you think. Give the utmost consideration in what you say and do. Send love.'
b'https://t.co/c9eDOwoJJm @stir_world @pulitzerarts'
b'When you send love to your loved one, you are not just sending love to the special person in your life, you are sending your love to yourself, our planet and the Universe automatically.'
b'People who are fighting do not feel that they are getting your understanding and love. What they need is love, and more love. Send love. Send as much love as you can.'
b'What A Mess (1973)\nhttps://t.co/PTgU1KmB8V'

b"If you keep hammering anti-abortion

b'"Can we change it?" To ask that question may even be considered crazy. But Yes, we can change, and we are doing it. Right now.'

b'Time is only a concept. It is up to us and how we want our end or the next beginning to be. Wake up the best of you. And we will make it. In fact we are making it now with passion and pride by meeting the highest challenge we have created for ourselves. What a game player we are!'
b'Make sure that you know that your rage is only to yourself, feeling helpless in this situation. Your are not helpless.'

b"Don't act like a person who is angry because the leaders of the world betrayed you. They did not betray you. They did not know that you were thinking differently from them. And if they knew, they would still follow their insticts, I'm sure."
b'We have been born in this particular time so we will need to open our super wisdom to go through this time of darkness. And we will.'
b'You can carry thoughts with real meaning wherever you are and whatever you are working on.'
b'Keep doing things you are inspired to do. It all helps.'
b'Be Peaceful yourself, if you want peace. Peace does not come easily to a violent soul.'
b'By making your life a life of love and peace, you will be adding something very important to the world.'
b'We will obtain world peace. Yes, we will. Believe it.'

b"Change will happen. Don't try to change the world. Change your head. World peace will instantly reign over us as we change our heads. And it will be done. We don't even have to lift our fingers. We just use our wits, which is all we have."

b'Sometimes it takes a frightening situation to make us realize we really want Peace - and fast.'
b'Give your children love and understanding so they can and will take care of themselves whatever the future may bring.'
b'You are not lost. Listen. You will hear the struggle and pain of others. Send them love in your mind.'
b'Start your day in a positive way by counting your blessings'

b'Send good thoughts every day. Change your heads, not the world.'
b'It is a waste of time to think "what if\xe2\x80\xa6?" Stand where you are now and allow the future to come into you.'
b"Are you allowing yourself to be surpressed? Shake it off in your mind. That's all you have to do. And the picture will change immediately."
b"When I wake up, I look around what I see and think how blessed I am. You, too. We are all blessed. Let's make the best of it."
b'Happiness and success are all in our minds. You can be happy just looking at a beautiful sky. You can think you were successful when you baked a great loaf of bread.'
b"We should have more stuff that we can't figure out. Mystery gives us some fun."

b'Love is the only energy we can rely on. And all of us have known it since birth, because it is the only energy and protection that kept us going. Breathing is one of the ways we give ourselves that energy, and give others too.'
b"When you have peace in your mind, you will get peace. If just enough people are really peaceful, we will get peace of togetherness. We're getting there!"
b'When will we be at peace, and is there a possibility there will ever be peace?'
b"Don't miss anything you bump into. It will give you insights into life."
b'Our heads are the source to think how to get peace. Our hearts are the source of courage to act.'

b"You have to be peaceful to get peace. If you are angry and combative, well, that is not going to help. Please send out the strongest energy of love, peace and belief to the world. We will still be too late to save some lives. But we don't have much option."

b'All we are saying is Give Peace A Chance.\nhttps://t.co/YeMKsqgMTi'
b'Negative thinking blocks, delays and slows down World Peace, Harmony and Love.'

b'Fall is when my mind becomes sharper. Winter is when it becomes easier to be more introspective. Spring is when I become totally aware of my love for everything in life. Summer is when I notice my daring energy & use it. All seasons are beautiful but different for each one of us.'
b'Make sure you keep your head straight. Believe in yourself that if you want to stay sane, you will.'
b'Keep on spreading Peace without fear.'
b'With being creative in giving, loving and thanking every day, you will be so busy, pretty soon you will forget about holding pain. I hope so. Be successful. You deserve it! Love, yoko'
b'Your brain is the thing that is creating your pain. I think your body is telling you that you are not thinking and doing things other than focusing on your pain.'

b'Love yourself for bravely sustaining your life for so many years.'
b"Don't wait for the moment for you to give in a big way. Just give a smile."

b'Concentrate your mind on giving, loving, and thanking. Each time you give, you are in less pain. Give as much as you can. Find something you can love. Love as much as you can. Thank as much as you can.'
b'We all have negative and positive things about ourselves. Pain is definitely negative. But you can change that pretty quickly.'
b'Water is a kind friend. It eliminates your pain as much as possible. A bath is more effective for that than a shower.'
b'To deal with anger, just say: "I love you, I forgive you, I accept you unconditionally." You are saying this to yourself. Keep saying it until you had enough.'

b"There are more people than politicians. Each one of us has the power to convince the world if we believe in ourselves. We'll make it."

b"You should know that life is lonely. You come out alone and you go out alone. If you know that, it will get better. Some people will love you and some won't. That's life. If you know that, it's a pretty good life."

b"Look yourself in the mirror and tell yourself that you really don't like violence. You don't get excited watching violent films or reading about violent incidents in the newspaper. Start with that. Start being non-violent yourself. And you will make a difference in the world."

b"It's easy to become sad. But when that happens, count your blessings and you will start to wonder why you were so sad. The blessings you brought in your life is all your doing. So you must be a great gal/guy. And quite lucky as well. Follow that luck and you will have happy days."

Happy BIrthday John!

I love you!

#IMAGINE50 https://t.co/KcSIrgZrGZ'

b'In our 14 years together John never stopped trying to improve himself from within. We were best friends. To me, he is still alive. Death alone doesn\xe2\x80\x99t extinguish a flame and a spirit like John.\n\n#TimsTwitterListeningParty #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/GkzHtDZ0f3'

b'Every day was different because he made it well for me.  He knew what I was going through, being a certain race and being a woman. At home he was a very gentle person and extremely concerned about me but also concerned about the world too. \n\n#TimsTwitterListeningParty #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/xQHbWjrxhk'

b'Between us, we were very psychic. We knew all the time what the other was thinking, what was going to be said by the other, our responses, everything. It was sometimes unnerving.\n\n#TimsTwitterListeningParty #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/wzrY1pGgpC'

b'John and Paul are very close to each other and when they were doing a session, they used to kid each other with words that may sound harsh to other people. I think it would have sounded very different to Paul.\n\n#TimsTwitterListeningParty #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/OcALFrQuuO'

b'I was a very lonely person before I met him. When I met John, I started to open up a little through love and that\xe2\x80\x99s the greatest thing that happened to me yet. I never met anybody else who could understand me.\n\n#TimsTwitterListeningParty #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/VypxA69e96'

b'He\xe2\x80\x99s saying, \xe2\x80\x98I see it clearly for the first time.\xe2\x80\x99 It\xe2\x80\x99s not so much about sexual interest or \xe2\x80\x98I miss you\xe2\x80\x99 \xe2\x80\x93 it\xe2\x80\x99s more to do with true love. What is love then? Love is when you understand each other so well that you finally relax.\n\n#TimsTwitterListeningParty #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/ZkRAsoswIb'

b"John designed the inner sleeve for the Imagine album and our Fluxus friend George Maciunas did the typography. There's a key to who all the photographs on the Imagine LP inner sleeve in the Imagine John Yoko book.\n\n#TimsTwitterListeningParty #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/yd4JKSWbbz"
b"John's Imagine and my FLY album covers were from polaroids we took of each other.\n\n#TimsTwitterListeningParty #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/xdhzQUdtMh"

b"King Curtis was fantastic. He came in and played wild, funky saxophone for many takes, different every time. We all loved every one of his takes and couldn't decide so Phil mixed all of them together and it sounded great!\n\n#TimsTwitterListeningParty #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/qMFR9Xsb5d"

b'Even now, I think there are people who still cannot reconcile themselves to the idea that I had been in John\xe2\x80\x99s life. To those people, I\xe2\x80\x99d like to say, I\xe2\x80\x99m sorry that we had hurt you, But that\xe2\x80\x99s what happened. That\xe2\x80\x99s how it was.\n\n#TimsTwitterListeningParty #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/fCTAnuIApd'

b'They say that Venus is jealous of lovers. Forget Venus. In our case it was the whole world. But as far as we were concerned, we felt so lucky that we had found each other.\n\n#TimsTwitterListeningParty #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/qteFBrsvNW'

b'John and I stood for peace and love but standing for peace doesn\xe2\x80\x99t make either of us holier than thou. John and I together were human beings. When we met we were like two driven people and it was like a fantastic meeting of two crazy souls.\n\n#TimsTwitterListeningParty #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/glXSWnWPoK'

b"\xe2\x80\x98Jealous Guy\xe2\x80\x99 was different: \xe2\x80\x98on the road to Marrakesh'
I said to John, \xe2\x80\x98That\xe2\x80\x99s a beautiful melody, but you have to think about something more sensitive - it\xe2\x80\x99s in you.\xe2\x80\x99
Whenever I hear it now, I think \xe2\x80\x98Oh my god!\xe2\x80\x99 because he really did that.

#TimsTwitterListeningParty #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/bHISwQH3QY"

b'RT @AbbeyRoad: To celebrate the 50th anniversary of @JohnLennon\xe2\x80\x99s iconic \xe2\x80\x98Imagine\xe2\x80\x99, the Abbey Road wall has been adorned with his famous pl\xe2\x80\xa6'

b"Join us now for John & Yoko's #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty Aftershow in @Spaces hosted by Chris Hawkins with Sean Ono Lennon, Klaus Voormann, Alan White, Nic Knowland, Dan Richter, Elliot Mintz, Tariq Ali, Paul Hicks, Simon Hilton & Tim Burgess.\nhttps://t.co/djxoozdpIz"

b'All of us have the responsibility to visualise a better world for ourselves and our children. The truth is what we create. It\xe2\x80\x99s in our hands. Remember, A dream you dream alone is only a dream A dream you dream together is reality. I love you! yoko #IMAGINE50 #IMAGINEPEACE https://t.co/Rxsi40d9cH'

b'We were on South Beach on Staten Island. \xe2\x80\x98Let\xe2\x80\x99s really upset them and end the film with us walking on water.\xe2\x80\x99 (I\xe2\x80\x99ll let you guess whose idea that was!) We tried \xe2\x80\x93 that is, I know it looked a bit awkward, but it was a windy day and the waves were rough. #TimsTwitterListeningParty'

b'John was a simple Liverpool man right to the end. He was a chameleon, a bit of a chauvinist, but so human. In our 14 years together he never stopped trying to improve himself from within. We were best friends. To me, he is still alive. Death doesn\xe2\x80\x99t extinguish a spirit like John. https://t.co/PaTdEKFCZG'
b'World Peace is definitely attainable. We are working on that now. You included. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/tofDcd0nnd'

b'We together declared to the world that we were a working partnership. It was a very intense and beautiful time for us. Both of us were activists already. So we spoke about it and said, \xe2\x80\x98Hey, that\xe2\x80\x99s what we can do together!\xe2\x80\x99  #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/4r1sdrfRC7'
b'When I think of Ascot I think of making the Imagine album and also just being together, strolling around in the gardens. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/gZSdM5eZ7T'

b'Between us, we were very psychic. We knew all the time what the other was thinking, what was going to be said by the other, our responses, everything. It was sometimes unnerving. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/tB9bLrTVbN'

b'I thought it was so funny that Diana goes on and on and in the end she comes across this sculpture that\xe2\x80\x99s mine, where you just put a little drop of water on. And that\xe2\x80\x99s all she does. And life is like that. You go on a heroic trip and at the end, what you do is not very much. https://t.co/tQqHEwacy4'

b'And Basho was a traveller, he loved to travel. He ended up falling ill at an inn and he wrote about his dreams running wild. It is the height of Romanticism. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/WinApwvBqX'

b'There is one beautiful poem by Basho: \xe2\x80\x98Sick on my journey | only my dreams will wander | these desolate moors.\xe2\x80\x99 The sense is that he can\xe2\x80\x99t move but his dreams are running wild. I just love that. His poems are almost like a travelogue and are very relevant to the journey of life. https://t.co/A67DVSMwLq'

b'The Japanese poet Matsuo Basho was an influence for me. Basho is minimal and very Zen and embodies the kind of Romanticism that I pursue in my work. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningPartya #Basho https://t.co/fUpbnA8Dzd'

b'George, we miss you! I hope you are hearing all this \xe2\x80\x93 in an Indian sense or in an Asian sense you are still with us, and you must be laughing about us! #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty @georgeharrison #AllThingsMustPass https://t.co/l3H0jPB0ZO'

b'George introduced Indian philosophy and Indian music to all of us, and that was a really important thing. America didn\xe2\x80\x99t have that kind of knowledge, and he made people understand it and realize there was some very deep music and philosophy there. #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/jwh0xjMbX5'

b'On all of the tracks on Imagine, George used his incredible talent really beautifully, precisely and with so much soul. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty @georgeharrison https://t.co/iFYtzePQPb'

b'George was technically so proficient. Of the four of them, he could really make it in that sense. In rock \xe2\x80\x99n\xe2\x80\x99 roll music, you don\xe2\x80\x99t need that so much \xe2\x80\x93 you go more for the \xe2\x80\x98feel\xe2\x80\x99. George knew that too, of course. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/yAxjZa3d9Z'

b'John and Paul were very close to each other and when they were doing a session, they used to kid each other with words that may sound harsh to other people. I think it would have sounded very different to Paul. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/nDcg9A0ctC'

b'Have you seen an evening light lately? If you have, watch it for a while, for you never know, it may not be the same. They say the evening light is sacred. Well, in my book, every moment in our lives is sacred, and incredibly enjoyable. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/rXuyNfAwo4'
b'We then pretended we had filmed it in Japan. I think it\xe2\x80\x99s OK to admit this now. I hope they don\xe2\x80\x99t mind!\n#IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/phVQs8wskT'

b'This was filmed at the beautiful shoin-style tea house designed by Junzo Yoshimura in the Japanese Garden of the Kykuit Rockefeller Mansion and Estate in Sleepy Hollow in upstate New York. We did the filming on the sly because we didn\xe2\x80\x99t have any permits #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/0fHeENjJks'
b'I sang normally in one and for fun I did a take-off of Elvis on the other. John selected the Elvis one to be on the record. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty'

b'I was surprised that he remembered the song I had shown him just briefly that morning. That\xe2\x80\x99s how \xe2\x80\x98Midsummer New York\xe2\x80\x99 was made. The musicians found a second wind and they played well. We did two takes with no rehearsal. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty'

b'In \xe2\x80\x9971, John and I made a brief visit to New York mainly to finish bits and pieces of Imagine. In the middle of the night, after long hours of recording, when the musicians looked totally exhausted, John suddenly said, \xe2\x80\x98Yoko says she\xe2\x80\x99s got something. Let\xe2\x80\x99s try.\xe2\x80\x99 #IMAGINE50'

b'I always wanted to make a song that uses the word \xe2\x80\x98shaking\xe2\x80\x99 with a double meaning, since I discovered the usage of the word in rock songs in 1968. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty'
b'MIDSUMMER NEW YORK.\nThis song is about the deep insecurity I have in me that I associate with my life in New York before I met John. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty'

b'We marched down Oxford Street, Shaftesbury Avenue, along Piccadilly and up to Grosvenor Square where the US Embassy was sealed off by police. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/SViGvmXX4C'

b'POWER TO THE PEOPLE.\nOn our way back from installing at Art Spectrum in Alexandra Palace we saw a march at Marble Arch and joined in. Someone handed John a megaphone and he led a chant of \xe2\x80\x98Power To The People\xe2\x80\x99. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/nbtrSV0WMF'

b'When you are feeling bad, do one thing a day to make your heart dance. It could be a simple thing like looking up at the sky. The blue of the sky is the colour that is always in my mind. I guess that\xe2\x80\x99s my favourite. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/WWZ9v7b65j'

b'There\xe2\x80\x99s something marvellous about it, because it\xe2\x80\x99s the sign of life, that life is continuing. And that\xe2\x80\x99s the kind of thing that my heart dances for. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/aDg2b3vn4z'

b'When I was young, I started to learn that very little things can really make your heart dance, like looking at the sky when the sky has a little shine or looking at the park when all the trees are frozen, but then you see that some trees are budding and you sense spring coming. https://t.co/rK0PdaddjP'

b'We had a lot of visitors. We met Dick Cavett then, whom John and I both liked very much. As a result, John and I were guests on Dick Cavett\xe2\x80\x99s TV show. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/K1A9GPNJhv'
b'Fred Astaire - John just loved this kind of thing. https://t.co/9Gk3sI64eZ'
b'Fred Astaire was so meticulous. He made us do 5 takes because he didn\xe2\x80\x99t like the way he was moving. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/CQOeALUO3b'

b'But I was not interested in just smashing a piano or a car or something \xe2\x80\x93 I was interested in the delicate way that things change \xe2\x80\x93 in that kind of destruction which, in a way, is more dangerous. I whispered a word and the word went around and got destroyed. #IMAGINE50'

b'WHISPER PIECE is performed by whispering a word into an audience\xe2\x80\x99s ear and asking to have it passed on until it reaches the last audience. I did it at the Destruction in Art Symposium in London 1966. 4 or 5 very hot-blooded male artists protested that my work was not destructive. https://t.co/pJvx8adLOa'
b'Eternal Time Clock, 1965\nA wound and ticking clock with the second, minute and hour hands removed. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/2dlcDLUUOJ'
b"That's my younger sister Setsuko, listening to my artwork. She plays snooker with us, later in the film. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/84yv9xCI1j"

b'\'Mind Train\' is something live musicians love. John loved it. When we were going to do a Yoko Ono Plastic Ono Band concert, Sean called me and said, \'you better do \'Mind Train\'. It\'s great! All I have to do is just keep saying, "dub, dub" while the musicians play! #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/QxMoY0Yqpn'
b'A future #TimsTwitterListeningParty?\n#JackPalance #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/bQPedCUgDr'

b'Jack Palance was great. We did it all spontaneously and he was really funny. After the filming, we signed a copy of the Imagine album for him as a thankyou gift. The next day he gave us a copy of his new album. It was all country and western songs. #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/Y7U37hsYQh'

b'New York in mid-August at the St Regis hotel, I was editing the Imagine film at the hotel and I was still adding a few new scenes. We found out that Jack Palance was staying at the hotel, so we sent May up to his suite to ask him if he would be in our film. #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/9fLH657aE4'

b"Listen to Jim Keltner\xe2\x80\x99s drumming. Klaus Voormann\xe2\x80\x99s bass, Chris Osborne\xe2\x80\x99s guitar and listen to the intricate conversation that goes between all of us in 'Mind Train'. Chris Osborne came from a guitar shop to sell a guitar to John. He stayed and played. #IMAGINE50"
b'John brought in musicians that are fine samurais. John, as a rhythm guitarist, leads the rhythm track, he pushes them to fly with me. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/vbjgSghJqa'

b'Most of the pieces on the FLY album are centred around a dialogue between my voice and John\xe2\x80\x99s guitar. John and I crawl, roll, and fly together. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/GeQdV6Jg51'
b'MIND TRAIN.\nJohn and I had fun recording that one.\n#IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/aYCf4jChNE'

b'John was a war child and so was I. He was born during the bombing of Liverpool while I was in a bomb shelter in Tokyo. In a war civilians are the ones who suffer the most. In the wars of the 20th century, 62 million civilians perished & 43 million military personnel were killed. https://t.co/yBIfuMgSMq'

b'We knew that people like us were the ones who really suffered, and the generals and the politicians just kept dishing out lies to keep us pacified. Never in a million years did we think that promoting World Peace could be dangerous. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/hC2Y7dbq54'

b"I DON'T WANNA BE A SOLDIER MAMA I DON'T WANNA DIE.\nBoth of us experienced World War Two from two opposite sides. We knew what it meant to be in the war. We knew how, suddenly, you could lose everything. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/SfpHGfIrwM"

b'In the world\xe2\x80\x99s eye we were Laurel and Hardy. In our minds we were Heathcliff and Cathy. In a moment of wisdom we were a wizard and a witch. In a moment of freedom, we were Don Quixote and Sancho. In reality, we were just a boy and a girl who never looked back.  #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/holibJ6LOQ'

b'John was the most romantic man I ever encountered. He said you have to water your love every day. John used to make me laugh, and I, him. We were great partners in that sense. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/W3osnwUHcE'

b'MRS. LENNON.\n\xe2\x80\x98Mrs. Lennon\xe2\x80\x99 was meant to be an ironic joke on me, by me, and an anti-war song. The lyrics were made in 1969, the music was finished in New York during the recording sessions. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/GaJn9h3zmd'

b'It\xe2\x80\x99s nice to slow down the rhythm of the whole world to make it peaceful. When you get in the bag it\xe2\x80\x99s very peaceful. I stood in Trafalgar Square in London wearing that bag before I met John thinking that if everybody wore this bag then there wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be any racial war #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/xpEuRiguFu'
b'From the white sneakers, it looks like John in the bag! #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/F1i00YkleR'

b'Actually it\xe2\x80\x99s the same. And we are all one. Life is not that defined. It\xe2\x80\x99s not black and white. You are not there to be an observer; you have to participate. But it\xe2\x80\x99s a participation that hits a very delicate chord in you. https://t.co/GgP5r6LoZe'

b'There comes a moment when you feel like maybe you want to cheat, or you want to convince your opponent which pieces were yours. Then there\xe2\x80\x99s a moment when you feel like it really doesn\xe2\x80\x99t matter which pieces are yours or the opponent\xe2\x80\x99s. #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/cObUG2dYKK'
b'My all-white chess game artwork is called Play It by Trust. Because the chess pieces on both sides are white, you always have to be aware of which are your pieces. https://t.co/LDaDyLihct'

b'7 is a conceptual number. 7, like 5, is a number you cannot find in our bodies (more so than 5) or in the nature around us. I call it a conceptual number or number of music because we divide the musical scale into 7. In time, we can only see it in the division of the week. https://t.co/Br4sVGp0qG'

b"I\xe2\x80\x99m very happy about what happened with the songs 'Airmale' and 'You' on the FLY album as a result of my session with Joe Jones' Tone Deaf Co. 'Airmale' in Yang and 'You' is Yin. 'Don\xe2\x80\x99t Count The Waves' is the water that connects the two Ying and Yang islands. #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/1HkPFRdpIq"

b'I asked Joe Jones, an old friend from the avant-garde, to make me instruments which were unlike any in the world. Making strange instruments was his thing. Joe came up with instruments which played themselves without any musicians. #IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/UnKySlwaXl'

b'I was fascinated by the idea of making special instruments for special emotions. Instruments that lead us to emotions arrived by their own motions rather than by our control. With those instruments I wanted to explore emotions & vibration which have not been explored yet in music https://t.co/SBZoPSLdrj'
b"DON'T COUNT THE WAVES is from my album FLY \n#IMAGINE50 #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/3UCoARhKQq"

b'When John first said, \xe2\x80\x98Let\xe2\x80\x99s use a helicopter\xe2\x80\x99, I \xe2\x80\x93 who was supposed to have sold out in a big way \xe2\x80\x93 thought, \xe2\x80\x98Oh dear, aren\xe2\x80\x99t we getting a bit Hollywood?\xe2\x80\x99 The result was that beautiful scene in \xe2\x80\x98Jealous Guy\xe2\x80\x99. There was nothing so-called \xe2\x80\x98Hollywood\xe2\x80\x99 about that. #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/s8gwWxGoRB'

b'John and I enjoyed make films together. John came up with big ideas, or ideas that seemed big to me at the time. He thought of using a helicopter, which added a new dimension to our film. #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/YfKAbCxDKN'

b"JEALOUS GUY.\nNicky Hopkins\xe2\x80\x99 playing on 'Jealous Guy\xe2\x80\x99 is so melodic and beautiful that it still makes everyone cry, even now. He was a genius. #IMAGINE50 https://t.co/xPiFevLFts"

b'The idea of not saying anything during the film \xe2\x80\x93 except in the beginning to just say \xe2\x80\x98Good morning\xe2\x80\x99 to each other \xe2\x80\x93 was John\xe2\x80\x99s. #IMAGINE50 #timstwitterlisteningparty https://t.co/Mncn1zuJhv'
b"Next time you meet a 'foreigner' remember it's only like a window with a little different shape to it and the person who's sitting inside is you."
b'IMAGINE.\nWell, here we are again, just two average people strolling through the park... https://t.co/e4NO3pQG83'

b'To ensure visitor safety & peace of mind, MEND PIECE for London has been adapted in consultation with the artist to accommodate social distancing. Sanitiser is available, ventilation has been increased & a member of @_TheWhitechapel staff is available at all times to assist.\n\n6/6 https://t.co/i8uitSXdr5'
b'In this artwork, the physical act of repair becomes a timely metaphor for a different kind of mending which takes place in the mind and through community.\n\n5/6 https://t.co/5OWEGifP5u'

b'MEND PIECE for London draws on the Japanese tradition of kintsugi, the art of repairing pottery using lacquer mixed with precious metals such as gold and silver. The process nurtures breakage as an important part of an object\xe2\x80\x99s history, rather than seeking to disguise it.\n\n4/6 https://t.co/r3cJmd6J6v'
b'When you have finished \xe2\x80\x98mending\xe2\x80\x99, you can display the results of your efforts along the shelves on the walls.\n\n3/6 https://t.co/Shy64nf6tD'

b'On entering Galleries 5 and 6, take a seat at a table on which are placed broken fragments of ceramic cups and saucers and some simple materials for repair \xe2\x80\x93 scissors, glue, twine and tape. \n\n2/6 https://t.co/kNFi8l44fC'

b'John was a brilliant man with a great sense of humour and understanding. He believed in being truthful and that the power of the people will change the world. And it will. https://t.co/bp8RADwVM6'

b'\xe2\x80\x98Cold Turkey\xe2\x80\x99 was something that reflected our life. And that\xe2\x80\x99s the kind of thing that always brings you trouble. So, from around \xe2\x80\x98Cold Turkey\xe2\x80\x99, we started to really pay our dues for being honest.  #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/FWznR5SuDw'

b'As an artist if you get truly inspired and something comes through you, like songs or poetry or whatever, then it\xe2\x80\x99s part of your experience. So you can\xe2\x80\x99t lie in your work. https://t.co/4MxLgwufFN'

b'He was so strong-minded. After the \xe2\x80\x98Lost Weekend\xe2\x80\x99, we both went on a juice fast for 40 days in 1975, just drinking fruit juice, and we cleaned ourselves. John had incredible will and once he decided to do something, he did it. Those 40 days were hard but we were totally clean. https://t.co/YIxvS5CzLf'

b"We were so totally scared. We thought it's an illegal thing, we can't openly go to hospital, they might arrest us. So we never even dreamt of going to hospital. We just cold turkey-ed. #ColdTurkey https://t.co/uDCRP0XKxf"

b'At the time it was a courageous thing to do. John was making the statement in a way that he was looking at the far, far future. I saw it in his eyes. He was saying, \xe2\x80\x98OK this is what we\xe2\x80\x99re going to do together.\xe2\x80\x99 And we\xe2\x80\x99re going to #GivePeaceAChance. To the world. https://t.co/bzbSJWzfhx'

b'The Bed-In was a definite part of it. It was a statement on a very theatrical level and I think it was very effective. We were artists and did it our own way. We felt very good about it then, and it was such an incredibly strange thing that we were doing. #GivePeaceAChance https://t.co/UIvq11xk5V'

b'All those Vietnam protests really changed the world. There was always that element who were really resisting it. That was the saving grace \xe2\x80\x93 that people were aware that they were that young generation who were really against it. And so it worked very well for the world. https://t.co/QAahjFNMNo'

b'People are so frantic about Daddies because Daddies are the ones that are never home and they never got enough of Daddy and somehow there\xe2\x80\x99s a distance, so there\xe2\x80\x99s a mystery about them and mystique. It was that adoration and yearning for Daddy. Whereas Mummy was always there. #God https://t.co/disEg3Pk40'

b'Without knowing the truth of what we are doing politically, we can never create a peaceful world. Integrity, sincerity and true dedication to their vocation. \nThese are the character traits needed in present politicians. Be true to yourself. Always. https://t.co/XVqbLkJbkQ'

b'The leaders of each country are being controlled by the military. They should come out and say that. If we know the truth, it doesn\xe2\x80\x99t necessarily mean we can end guns and wars right away, but knowing the truth will do something to our brains, and it will know what to do. https://t.co/3iDamdJuSd'

b'In the end it is the power of the people that will change the world. And it will. So, let\xe2\x80\x99s not get discouraged. Keep communicating the truth to the world as much as we can. Peaceful and truthful protests are the only way, because nothing else works.  #WellWellWell https://t.co/27SDkJoJAY'

b'John was a brilliant writer, a brilliant artist and a brilliant man, who believed in being truthful. More people should get down to being truthful to themselves. That is the most adventurous thing anybody can do. You may not know it at the time, but truth is setting you free. https://t.co/uhkssFLp9l'

b'If you have a slave around the house, how can you expect to make a revolution outside it? The problem for women is that if we try to be free, then we naturally become lonely. So you always have to take the chance: \xe2\x80\x98Am I going to lose my man?\xe2\x80\x99 It\xe2\x80\x99s very sad. https://t.co/kgTBjlPLjR'

b'Love is the energy that is really moving the whole world. Love is the creative energy and prayer is the poor man\xe2\x80\x99s weapon. With prayer and love we can really create the world. Please send out the strongest energy of love, peace and belief to the world. https://t.co/XiwsrA1nbl'

b'John was looking into a mirror at his own soul and soon realised the fundamental truths he discovered for himself was advice needed by everybody: feel your own pain, learn to cry, believe in yourself, love is real, it\xe2\x80\x99s gonna be all right. #Remember #TimsTwitterListeningParty https://t.co/fd98sev0ZO'

b'At one point, John wanted to call his album \xe2\x80\x98Primal\xe2\x80\x99 and my album \xe2\x80\x98Scream\xe2\x80\x99, but I had been screaming long before we started therapy, and we realized the therapy, whatever its title, was just a mirror. https://t.co/IBUBUp1i47'

b'During 1970, we did intensive Primal Scream therapy for six months and many of the songs were inspired as a result of those sessions. John\xe2\x80\x99s songs were a literate expression of his feelings and I was more interested in expressing my feelings using revolutionary vocal sounds. https://t.co/tHCQEeWf27'

b'People don\xe2\x80\x99t want to know about problems. People want somebody to always tell them it\xe2\x80\x99s OK. And so it\xe2\x80\x99s gonna be a little bit less popular, but it shouldn\xe2\x80\x99t be if the world gets more mature. They should understand that that\xe2\x80\x99s more important somehow. https://t.co/mJyaihZFA3'

b'The Beatles were just saying to people, \xe2\x80\x98It\xe2\x80\x99s gonna be OK\xe2\x80\x99 and then suddenly John comes out with this Plastic Ono Band album \xe2\x80\x93 \xe2\x80\x98Working Class Hero\xe2\x80\x99 and \xe2\x80\x98God\xe2\x80\x99 and all that, saying, \xe2\x80\x98It\xe2\x80\x99s not OK. There are these problems.\xe2\x80\x99 https://t.co/V4mPbcKeLc'

b'You have to be peaceful to get peace. If you are angry and combative, well, that is not going to help. Our heads are the source to think how to get peace. Our hearts are the source of courage to act. When you have peace in your mind, you will get peace. https://t.co/dIIh6VwqWy'

b'Keep on spreading peace without fear. Make sure you keep your head straight. Believe in yourself that if you want to stay sane, you will. Negative thinking blocks, delays and slows down world peace, harmony and love. https://t.co/vqveUfuNKS'

b'Don\xe2\x80\x99t bottle love because then it will just sit in the bottle, or escape from the bottle. Pretty soon you will see an empty bottle in your hand. Anything that is at odds with one other should be forgotten. Just hold on to what we agree on. That is where the power is. https://t.co/3eqA0TY3UU'
b'It was a revolution for a Beatle to say, \xe2\x80\x98Listen: I\xe2\x80\x99m human, I\xe2\x80\x99m real.\xe2\x80\x99 It took a lot of courage for him to do it. https://t.co/hpS0czMn85'
b'We were influencing other artists, giving them courage; giving dignity to a certain style of vulnerability and strength that was not accepted in society at the time. https://t.co/x6rMLVbX6J'
b'With the Plastic Ono Band albums, John and I liked the idea of this really raw, basic, truthful reality that we were going to be giving to the world. https://t.co/qVc0v7EQhF'

b'WILL YOU TOUCH ME?, 1971

Nothing in the world can open my heart but some kindness

b'9/9 \xe2\x80\x9cLife is what happens to you while you\xe2\x80\x99re busy making other plans.\xe2\x80\x9d JL, 1980.\n\nYO, 2000.'

b'8 Karuizawa was not fun when that started. John just sat in the hotel room and made collages. Then we packed and left for Tokyo, then home to N.Y. We got busy with other things and, as fate would have it, we never went back there again. I was left with the lighter.'

b'7 \xe2\x80\x9cShall we go back to get it?\xe2\x80\x9d I asked. \xe2\x80\x9cYeah, let\xe2\x80\x99s,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. Then he changed his mind \xe2\x80\x9cOh, never mind. I\xe2\x80\x99ll get it tomorrow when we\xe2\x80\x99re there,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. But tomorrow never came. The rainy season started the next day. It rained cats and dogs for several days without stopping.'

b'6 I was going fast on my bike. He was shouting something to me from behind. \xe2\x80\x9cWhat?\xe2\x80\x9d I shouted. \xe2\x80\x9cI left me lighter at the coffee house!\xe2\x80\x9d John shouted back. \xe2\x80\x9cThe one I bought yesterday!\xe2\x80\x9d I knew he liked that one. I slowed down and turned my head around.'

b'5 Then I remembered the day that John had left the lighter at the coffee house. The three of us went there to spend the afternoon as usual. Right in the middle of our bike ride home, John remembered that he had left the lighter at the coffee house.'

b'4 I had a cup of coffee and left. The owner came running after me and handed me a lighter. \xe2\x80\x9cYour husband left this the last time he was here,\xe2\x80\x9d he said. I looked at him and the lighter. \xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99d like to return this to you.\xe2\x80\x9d I lit the lighter. The flame shot up, like it was alive.'

b'3 After John\xe2\x80\x99s passing, 5 years from the time we were last there together, I visited the coffee shop again. It was as if time had stood still. There was the same stillness in the shop with only a few people sitting around. The scent of pine and aroma of good coffee was in the air'

b'2 To get there, you had to go cycling for about 30 minutes from the town of Karuizawa. But we loved going there. There was a big hammock in the backyard, and John, Sean and I used to spend the afternoon lying in it, giggling, singing, and watching the sky.'

b'1/9 THE LIGHTER\nKaruizawa is an old summer resort in Japan very much like the Hamptons except it\xe2\x80\x99s in the mountains. There is a coffee house in a pine forest near Karuizawa. John & I fell in love with the place, and found ourselves going there almost every day with Sean. https://t.co/y5pTM7GLI7'

b'17 Let us wake up, come together, and work on cleaning and healing our planet, instead of further destroying it. Let\xe2\x80\x99s not waste one more day in creating a machinery of destruction. Give us a chance. On behalf of ourselves and all species on earth. We can do it. We must.'

b"16 This beautiful world of ours can still survive and survive well, if we focus our minds and actions in cleaning it up instead of poisoning & destroying it further. It\xe2\x80\x99s clean-up time as @JohnLennon said. It's not too late. It cannot be. We must give this planet one more chance."

b'15 I wake up in the morning and see the blue sky and the birds singing in the park. Every day, I am thankful for being alive. I enjoy the life on this planet, immensely, and the culture and the civilization we, humans have created in the course of many, many centuries.'
b'14 Since the world is one body, we cannot drop a bomb far enough from ourselves to not get affected by its consequence. In fact, if we drop a bomb anywhere, we are dropping it on ourselves.'
b'13 Why make it even harder for this planet by continuing to increase the production of the most dangerous weapon known to us? Are we doing this to use the bomb? If we are, we must be crazy.'
b'12 Many of my friends, young and old, are now suffering from physical deterioration and mental depression. It seems that we are polluting and killing ourselves before anybody drops a bomb on us.'

b'11 Nuclear Power can be very dangerous, even when it\xe2\x80\x99s used as pure energy, supposedly, in a contained form. Remember Chernobyl, our Three Mile Island and Nevada Nuclear Test Site and how the world is still being affected by them.'

b'10 Each time we breathe air, we are polluting our bodies. They have discovered pesticides and poisons in meat, fish, vegetables and fruit, and our mothers milk. The current condition of our environment is already challenging our immune system to it\xe2\x80\x99s limits.'

b'9 From the heavy usage of various chemicals and pesticides and with the radio active dust and rain from nuclear tests sites, our land is polluted, our rivers, lakes and oceans are polluted, and even our air is seriously polluted.'
b'8 If we want to see this planet survive, NO MORE HIROSHIMA OR NAGASAKI is a necessary wake up call for all of us. We are already living in strange times without adding the threat of a Nuclear War.'

b'7 The Hibakushas have bravely and wisely turned their experience into a warning to the world by saying: NO MORE HIROSHIMA OR NAGASAKI. There has not been a time when this warning has been so important as it is now.'

b'6 In fact, their long and excruciatingly painful journey had begun then and is still continuing to this day over half a century later. It is a suffering of a lifetime & more. In fact it affected all of us on this planet. Nuclear damage does not disappear. It circulates and stays.'

b'5 When I was twelve years old, in 1945, the cities of Hiroshima, Nagasaki and their people were devastated by the Atomic Bomb. The war was pretty much at the end by then. But the unbearable sufferings of the Hibakushas did not end there.'

b'4 Those experiences of the early days cast a long shadow in my life. More than half a century later, I still have a hard time throwing away empty paper bags and plastic containers. My children think that\xe2\x80\x99s quirky. Well, it must be.'

b'3 Eventually, we, children, were evacuated to the country. The food was scarce. I remember we were always hungry. It was not just food. There was a shortage of everything, even toilet paper. So we managed with what we had and became rather inventive.'

b'2 I was in Tokyo during the Second World War. In the middle of the night, we were woken up to go down into the shelter while the B29s firebombed our city. It was frightening to see fire burning down the houses around us.'

b'Even when everything was falling apart around me, the sky was always there for me. It was the only constant factor in my life, which kept changing with the speed of light and lightening. As I told myself then, I could never give up on life as long as the sky was there.\n\n1996'

b'Towards the end of the Second World War, I looked like a little ghost because of the food shortage. I was hungry. It was getting easier to just lie down and watch the sky. That\xe2\x80\x99s when I fell in love with the sky, I think.\nSince then, all my life, I have been in love with the sky.'

b'If you want to find out what you can do to help change the world, you are already the solution. You are changing the world just by starting to think about what to do. The answer to what you should do will come from your heart.'
b'People are finally standing up to let the politicians know that they will not stand for political lies and stupidity which do not help the human race, and the nature of our planet.'

b"We wrote and put out a song called POWER TO THE PEOPLE. It's happening. Time is a concept we human beings created. It doesn't matter if it is happening in a big way now after 40 years or so. 40 years can be forever if we don't do anything about it- and can be 4 minutes if we did."
b'The fight at dawn is the severest, they say. Stand up together and make our world better.'
b"Peaceful and truthful protests are the only way, because nothing else works. Don't ask how. Just do it in the way you can."

b'I love rainbows! The double rainbows covering the sky over my farm after the rain, small prisms sitting on my desk\xe2\x80\xa6 but the best is the rainbow coming from the window and putting extra colours on one of the paintings on the wall!  \xf0\x9f\x8c\x88'
b'Art means creativity. We will put together all of our creativity and make a great world. Yes, we will!'
b'Look at your awesome self in the mirror. It is where you are getting your energy from and giving to us as well. I love you!'
b'I hope you take the time to look at yourself in the mirror and tell yourself how great you are. Greatness is what we all share to keep working on bettering our world.'
b'While you are doing something that makes you love it, you will learn many things. Reading books is not the only way you learn about life.'
b'Each time you give what you created with love to the world, it comes back to you in tenfold. So don\xe2\x80\x99t be afraid. GIVE!'
b"Next time you meet a 'foreigner', remember it's only like a window with a different shape to it and the person who's sitting inside is you."

b"In Japan we have three rituals: HANAMI, TSUKIMI, and YUKIMI. HANAMI is watching the flowers. TSUKIMI is watching the moon, YUKIMI is watching the snow. It's a beautiful tradition when you invite people to watch with you. I remember them all."
b"In Japan, you always check the cherry blossom in April. It's everywhere. People go to the park to watch the beautiful flowers. That's called HANAMI. 'Observing the Flowers' ritual."
b"You can fill emptiness, you can cry and get over sadness, and you don't have to regret anything."

b'Freely imbued in this way with a multiplicity of thoughts, each time Add Color (Refugee Boat) is shown it both shares in the memory of past iterations, while taking on a life and a meaning of its own - acutely reflecting the time, place and people that come together to create it.'

b'As the installation progresses, messages will be written in support, contrast and literal obfuscation of one another, moving the space from visual calm to a layered visual chaos - a beautiful sea of color from afar, a more restless reality upon closer inspection.'
b'Upon opening, the work will be comprised simply of a boat placed within an empty space. The public will then be invited to paint their thoughts, ideas and hopes on the walls, floor and boat.'
